content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Cable Factory at approximately (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the key production‐line components for copper cable manufacture:
• Input Chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5) serving as the factory interface  
• Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) using direction RIGHT, placed adjacent to the input chest  
• Burner Inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) that links into the factory system  
• Assembling Machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5) for processing copper cable recipes  
• Burner Inserter at Position(x=1.5, y=17.5) (fuelled with coal) supporting item transfer in the production line

### Depot Belt System at (3.5, 15.5)
Provides an isolated belt depot for intermediate item transfer between extraction and production:
• Wooden Chest Depot at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) placed to serve as the belt depot  
• Transport Belt Segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) located adjacent to the depot chest  
• Depot Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) using direction UP, positioned immediately beside the depot chest

### Extraction System Node at (-3.5, 27.5)
Supports extraction operations by handling drop‐off of mined items:
• Extraction System Burner Inserter at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with a drop position at Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5)

### Electricity Generator at (-0.5, 24.5)
Integrates components for power generation:
• Steam Engine at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)  
• Boiler at Position(x=-5.5, y=24.0)  
• Offshore Pump at Position(x=-7.5, y=25.5)

### Laboratory (Position not specified)
Facilitates research and processing of science packs:
• Lab with input {'automation-science-pack': 17} and electrical_id=7106

ERROR TIPS

• Transport Belt Connection Issues  
 – When connecting transport belts, always use an inserter as the target rather than attempting to connect directly to a steam engine. This prevents errors such as “Transport belts cannot be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object.”

• Placement Distance and Inventory Verification  
 – Ensure that the agent is close enough to the target position before attempting to place an entity to avoid distance‐related placement errors.  
 – Verify that the inventory contains the required entity (for example, a wooden chest) before attempting its placement.

• Undefined Variable References  
 – Check that all variables (such as the intended target entity) are correctly defined and referenced to avoid NameError exceptions (e.g. “target_chest is not defined”).
